channel.title: What should I progress this into?
channel.description:
Just built a pretty nifty application, reads bank items from in-game and displays them on the site with images. I can switch this to reading inventory items too.
Here is a basic example of just a few items.. http://tinypic.com/r/i71pb7/8
But no need to worry, supports hundreds of items too. http://tinypic.com/r/2e4jne1/8
[b]Bugs so far[/b] Runescape likes to do this thing where it stores as you having item id 4152 which is a noted whip, when you really have 4151 (unnoted whip). Currently I have it reading the image as $itemID-1.. Which works fine for the noted items, but not the items that cannot be noted.
Anyways, what should I progress this into? I was thinking of a web-based grand exchange. And also into an administration panel for admins (to check player inventories/banks).
I have all items in 25x25 resolution, and all items in 96x96 resolution.
Forgot to throw in credits. [b]SK8rDude[/b] - Helping me rip the item images from my cache by giving me a method from [b]Galkon[/b] [b]Runescape[/b] - Having a simple set up that allowed me to rip the grand-exchange view of the items (in 96x96)

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:18, topic:543855”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=662734.msg4430407#msg4430407 date=1403001018]

When player takes item out, have it save. Simple

lets run 2000 players banks constantly saving every 10 seconds of the day im sure that wont make the server take a shit on itself

We’d first need 2000 players on 1 server, with 10-100 players. Should be fine, and not everyone is in the bank at once.

If people stress test their servers to 2000 players why wouldn’t you stress test your other features to the same standard?

This is why RSPS kick the bucket, no one cares about attention to detail.

If you build the uprights of a bridge being able to withstand a downward force of 350kN why would you build the road being able to withstand 35kN of downward force? Why bother making one part of the creation largely above tolerance and another part largely below such a tolerance. Laziness is no excuse.
[/quote]

Why waste time in your life when you can make something just as efficient. Perhaps update everytime they close bank then just move 1 item?[/quote]

Because it’s not just as efficient, I made that clear in the last post. If you make one thing to a certain standard, make everything to that standard. This is what’s known as not being an idiot. You work to a certain standard on one aspect of a job, you work to that standard for everything.

Read full topic
item.source: What should I progress this into?

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:18, topic:543855”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=662734.msg4430407#msg4430407 date=1403001018]

When player takes item out, have it save. Simple

lets run 2000 players banks constantly saving every 10 seconds of the day im sure that wont make the server take a shit on itself

We’d first need 2000 players on 1 server, with 10-100 players. Should be fine, and not everyone is in the bank at once.

If people stress test their servers to 2000 players why wouldn’t you stress test your other features to the same standard?

This is why RSPS kick the bucket, no one cares about attention to detail.

If you build the uprights of a bridge being able to withstand a downward force of 350kN why would you build the road being able to withstand 35kN of downward force? Why bother making one part of the creation largely above tolerance and another part largely below such a tolerance. Laziness is no excuse.
[/quote]

Why waste time in your life when you can make something just as efficient. Perhaps update everytime they close bank then just move 1 item?[/quote]

++ An efficient way would be to have the bank saved to SQL also, and when a player closes the bank, it checks the current state of the bank, and amends changes (if any) to the SQL version. Honestly, there isn’t really a way that this system can be super efficient, and mass-scaled. This would be perfect for users that are suspected dupers, and you add them onto a watch list. Where if they’re on the watch list, their bank, inventory, stats, etc. Are saved to SQL for moderating.

EDIT: I literally made up the whole watch list thing on the spot, now it’s time to do it. o.O

Read full topic
item.source: What should I progress this into?

If you build the uprights of a bridge being able to withstand a downward force of 350kN why would you build the road being able to withstand 35kN of downward force? Why bother making one part of the creation largely above tolerance and another part largely below such a tolerance. Laziness is no excuse.[/quote]

Why waste time in your life when you can make something just as efficient. Perhaps update everytime they close bank then just move 1 item?

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

As it stands, I have the bank saving to SQL on log out. It inserts a row into the table per item in bank. It’s not extremely slow. Logout takes ~.7 seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:12, topic:543855”]I’m working on a system for someone where players can swap bank items and delete them from the site. With the nice garbage icon for deleting items. Since the bank is saved to SQL, this works out nicely. However, it does have a delay from switching items and running a query each time. I’m probably going to have it so that after a player switches everything, they hit a save button. Then again, this could leave vulnerabilities for duping.

What type of game/sql/site integration tool do I make next? [/quote]
Make a working server/website report system.
I saw one in the past but it’s links are down I believe.

Read full topic
item.source: What should I progress this into?

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I’m working on a system for someone where players can swap bank items and delete them from the site. With the nice garbage icon for deleting items. Since the bank is saved to SQL, this works out nicely. However, it does have a delay from switching items and running a query each time. I’m probably going to have it so that after a player switches everything, they hit a save button. Then again, this could leave vulnerabilities for duping.

What type of game/sql/site integration tool do I make next?

Read full topic
item.source: What should I progress this into?

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I personally have mine save when it sets the bank flag false.
Because you can exit the bank window in a variety of ways, you need to account for them.

if(banking) {
banking = false;
//Save here
}

Read full topic
item.source: What should I progress this into?

[/quote]
lets run 2000 players banks constantly saving every 10 seconds of the day im sure that wont make the server take a shit on itself[/quote]

Then again, how many servers have 2000 players? And not all 2000 of those players are going to be executing queries every 10 seconds.

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

One method RSCD used is having the login server able to be queried live. So I could make a socket connection to localhost:xxxx, send a specific string like “bank username”, and it could return a list of their items. This pretty much allowed you to interact with players in real time from the website.

Read full topic
item.source: What should I progress this into?

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:4, topic:543855”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662734.msg4429340#msg4429340 date=1402466825]
Now get an image of the bank, and then make it look just like the bank from in game.
[/quote]

Then what? Haha.

Have it save not just when the player logs. Live updating.

That’d be nice to do, not sure how to do that server-sided. Would I have the website request the bank in-game?[/quote]I’d probably develop a separate service to update the values ever x seconds.

Read full topic
item.source: What should I progress this into?

item.title: What should I progress this into?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:4, topic:543855”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662734.msg4429340#msg4429340 date=1402466825]
Now get an image of the bank, and then make it look just like the bank from in game.
[/quote]

Then what? Haha.

Have it save not just when the player logs. Live updating.

That’d be nice to do, not sure how to do that server-sided. Would I have the website request the bank in-game?[/quote]

For my part, I was just saying that it’d look better (aesthetics and shit) if you made it look (and scroll) like the bank.

And for Kozs, server sided you would update the SQL database when the player exits the bank, how you will manage that is up to you.

Read full topic
